com.github.tilastokeskus.matertis.core

Class AbstractGameHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.github.tilastokeskus.matertis.core.AbstractGameHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameHandler

    public abstract class AbstractGameHandler
extends Observable
    Provides fundamental functionality to control the flow of a game. This class controls the game's time and scoring related tasks.
    Author:
    tilastokeskus
    See Also:
    Game, ScoreHandler, Difficulty

      Simulates the next round of the game.
      void notifyObservers(Object arg)
      Follows the behavior as defined by Observable, but in addition calls Observable.hasChanged().

      Resets the handler to the state in which it was initialized into by the constructor.

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets the handler to the state in which it was initialized into by the constructor.

      • restartGame

        public abstract void restartGame()
        Restarts the game and notifies all observers with message: "restart"

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers(Object arg)
        Follows the behavior as defined by Observable, but in addition calls Observable.hasChanged().
        Overrides:
        notifyObservers in class Observable
        Parameters:
        arg - message to send to observers.

      • startGame

        public abstract void startGame()
                        throws LaunchException
        Starts the game and notifies all observers with message: "start"
        Throws:
        LaunchException - thrown when the game cannot be started due to uninitialized or invalid mandatory fields.

      • nextRound

        protected abstract void nextRound()
        Simulates the next round of the game. Notifies all observers with the message: "next"

      • terminateGame

        public abstract void terminateGame()
        Ends the running game and notifies all observers with message: "end"

      • togglePause

        public abstract void togglePause()
        Toggles the pause-state of the game. When paused, the game should not advance. Notifies all observers with message: "pause" or "resume"

      • isRunning

        public abstract boolean isRunning()
        Returns whether or not the game is currently running. The game is running when the handler has been started, it is not paused, and the game is not over.
        Returns:
        true if the game is running, false if not.
